p: Acanthamoeba triangularis WU19001 was grown in culture flasks containing Peptone-Yeast Extract-Glucose (PYG) medium as reported ( Niyyati et al., 2013; Mitsuwan et al., 2020b). The medium contained 18 g glucose, 20 g proteose peptone, 2 g yeast extract, 0.98 g MgSO 4 × 7H 2O, 1 g sodium citrate dihydrate, 0.02 g Fe (NH 4) 2 (SO 4) 2 × 6H 2O, 0.34 g KH 2PO 4, 0.355 g Na 2HPO 4×7H 2O, and 1,000 mL distil water. Cultured flasks were incubated at room temperature. Subsequently, trophozoites and cysts were harvested after 3 and 7 days, respectively.
